arm_group.description: The baseline survey will be implemented among pregnant women in randomly selected villages using a continuous enrollment schedule over the period of 18 months
The programmatic impact of optimized prenatal care services on women's health and behavior will be assessed among pregnant women in randomly selected villages

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood and urine sample for assessment of nutritional status

brief_summary.textblock:
A national survey in Niger found that women and children are at risk of undernutrition and
      that many pregnant women don't visit health centers during pregnancy as often as is
      recommended. The aim is to assess the nutritional and health status of pregnant women in the
      Zinder region and to understand their knowledge, attitudes and practices related to health
      and nutrition during pregnancy. In collaboration with the Medical District of Zinder the
      prenatal care services will be optimized and the programmatic impact on gestational weight
      gain and anemia prevalence will be assessed.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of the Nutritional Status of Pregnant Women and Optimization of Prenatal Care Services

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Pregnant

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Pregnant women, who have severe illness warranting immediate hospital referral

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant women residing in participating villages

intervention.description: To further integrate and improve nutrition-related services and messages in the prenatal care package.

clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of the Nutritional Status of Pregnant Women in Zinder, Niger and Optimization of Prenatal Care Services

primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of inadequate gestational weight gain
Access and adherence to prenatal iron and folic acid supplements

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of inadequate dietary diversity scores

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
